name: coarsely
content:
coarsely adverb
(roughly)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is rough and not smooth or soft, or not in very small pieces: Chop the cabbage coarsely. coarsely ground black pepper
More examplesFewer examplesCrush the peppercorns coarsely.Polenta is made with ground yellow or white cornmeal, which can be ground coarsely or finely depending on the region.The coarsely shredded meat is cooked with onion.Add 500g raw carrot, washed and coarsely grated.

coarsely adverb
(rudely)
in a way that is rude and offensive: I had never heard anyone speak so coarsely before. The play is about a group of British men behaving coarsely and conspicuously while on holiday.
More examplesFewer examples"Crap," Pamela said coarsely, surprising everyone.Nobody behaves coarsely, although there's a lot of innuendo.The actress has the rare ability to speak coarsely and emote sensitively at the same time.
